description.p: A lyrist’s fingers glide across her instrument as her allies face the terrible dragon before them. The melody rumbles deeply in their ears as they steel themselves for the great battle to come.
Chanting a song of strength, an orc summons a deep well of courage within his brothers and sisters—inspiring them to charge ahead.
A halfling strikes his drum, pulling on the threads of magic that erupt from his instrument to weave together healing relief for his injured companion.
Neither wizards or bards of long past, minstrels are talented musicians, performers, and speakers. By combining song, dance, music, and arcane power, minstrels to create wondrous magic like no other.

Many are the magic practitioners across the land. However, few of them see through the veil of arcana like minstrels do. Sounds and words, hold vast and innumerable power. And minstrels are the select few who have learned to harness and weave that power. What a simple plucked string or the boom of a drum is to some people is raw, craftable, and reachable magic to a minstrel—song and dance are their paintbrushes and the world is their canvas.

In the chaos of battle, minstrels can be seen on the outer edges of the fray: bolstering their allies with their powerful songspells. Some minstrels, however, seek the heat of battle themselves and willingly charge into a fight—eagerly bellowing chants of fire and steel alongside their companions. Wherever you might see one—a minstrel is always a welcome comrade on the field.

One would be quick to assume that minstrels travel the land in search of the next legendary deed to write ballads over or the next great world changing event to solidify their place in history with. While some, in fact, do, many minstrels do not chase fame or heroic pinings.

Some minstrels line themselves up as caravan guards, using their musical repertoire to aid their fellow guardsman in whatever threats they might meet along the road. Other minstrels earn their keep as mercenaries and freelancers—offering their spectacular gifts in exchange for some coin. Minstrels are even found among dangerous, specialized excursions deep into untold lands: a beacon of comfort and reassurance in the face of the black dirges of the unknown.

As you create a minstrel, think of where your character learned their musical gifts. Did they study under a kingdom famous musical genius? A warm, neighborly old woman who once played for the king? Perhaps your character is self taught—a prodigy of natural art just waiting for her moment to shine upon the land.

What caused you to leave hearth and home? Were you called upon by a special request in favor of your musical abilities? Are you a wanderer and traveler constantly seeking bed and bread in exchange for tune? Or perhaps you’re a writer: constantly seeking the “spark” that will become the greatest ode in all of the land?
You can make a minstrel quickly by following these suggestions. First, Charisma should be your highest ability score, followed by Constitutuon. Second, choose the entertainer background.
As an minstrel, you gain the following class features.

ul.li: Hit Points at 1st Level: 8 + your Constitution modifier
Hit Points at Higher Levels: 1d8 (or 5) + your Constitution modifier per minstrel level after 1st
Weapons: Simple weapons, hand crossbows, longswords, rapiers, shortswords
Tools: Three musical instruments of your choice
Skills: Performance and any two other skills

description.p: You start with the following equipment, in addition to the equipment granted by your background:

ul.li: (a) a rapier, (b) a longsword, or (c) any simple weapon
(a) a diplomat’s pack or (b) an entertainer’s pack
(a) a lute or (b) any other musical instrument

description.p: At 1st level, you have a natural knack for motivating and inspiring others to greater action whether through words or music. Your proficiency bonus is doubled for Charisma (Performance) checks.
Unlike the bards of old, your songs rally those around you to greater feats of action. You pull on the threads of magic to fuel your music with powerful effects called songspells.

You can play a number of songspells equal to your Charisma modifier. To play a known songspell, you expend one use of your songcraft as an action. A songspell and its effects end at the beginning of your next turn but can be maintained until the beginning of the following turn as a bonus action until your concentration is broken (as if concentrating on a spell). A songspell has a maximum duration of 1 minute, at which you spend another use of songcraft to continue its effect. You regain any expended uses during a short or long rest.
You can only have one songspell active at any time. Changing a songspell from one effect to another requires you to stop the previous performance and start a new one as an action.
You can use an instrument as a spellcasting focus for your songspells.
description.h5: SONGS KNOWN OF 1ST LEVEL AND HIGHER
description.p: At 1st level, you know one songspell of your choice from the songspell list. The Songs Known column of the Minstrel table shows when you learn more songspells of your choice.
Additionally, when you gain a level in this class, you can choose one of the songspells you know and replace it with another songspell that you could learn at that level.

If a songspell has prerequisites, you must meet them to learn it. You can learn the songspell at the same time that you meet its prerequisites. A level prerequisite refers to your level in this class.

You can change your known songspells when you finish a long rest. Memorizing new songspells requires time spent practicing the music and magic required to cast the songspell: at least 1 minute per songspell.

Some of your songspells require your target to make a saving throw to resist the feature’s effects. You use your Charisma modifier when setting the saving throw DC for a songspell you use and when making a spell attack roll with one.
Songspell Save DC = 8 + your proficiency bonus + your Charisma modifier
Songspell attack modifier = your proficiency bonus + your Charisma modifier

sheet.description: You can cast songspells. You can memorize up to {{minstrel:spellcasting:prepare}} songspells during a long rest.

description.p: No minstrel is like another. Music of the land continues to evolve throughout history, yet there are a few integrations of magic and song that have stood strong against the sands of time. Though every minstrel displays a unique style and identity, their magic through music tends to manifest in a multitude of recognizable ways.

At 2nd level, you have started to develop your own rhythm when using your songcraft. Choose the Battle Dancer, Precentor, String Marstra, or Rhythm Knight, all detailed at the end of the class description. Your choice grants you features at 2nd level and again at 3rd, 6th, and 14th level.

Beginning at 2nd level, you can double your proficiency bonus when rolling Intelligence checks to recognize written or oral songs, poems, or other verse. If the piece in question is in a language you do not understand, you can still understand the base emotion, feeling, and intention of it even if you cannot translate it directly.

sheet.description: You can double your proficiency bonus when rolling Intelligence checks to recognize written or oral songs, poems, or other verse. If the piece in question is in a language you do not understand, you can still understand the base emotion, feeling, and intention of it even if you cannot translate it directly.

description.p: When you reach 4th level, and again at 8th, 12th, 16th, and 19th level, you can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can’t increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.

Starting at 5th level, you can use your reaction to immediately play a new songspell that you know in place of a currently active songspell without expending a use of Songcraft. You can use this feature twice at 5th level, and three times at 15th level.
You regain uses of this feature after a short or long rest.

sheet.description: You can immediately play a new songspell that you know in place of a currently active songspell without expending a use of Songcraft.

description.p: Beginning at 9th level, you can have up to two songspells active simultaneously. You can spend an action activating a second songspell, at which a second songspell effects are applied simultaneously, and you cannot choose a songspell that is already active.

You can continue to use your bonus action on subsequent turns to maintain your songspell and both songspell effects are maintained in this way. If your concentration is broken, you lose both effects immediately.

sheet.description: You can spend an action activating a second songspell, at which a second songspell effects are applied simultaneously, and you cannot choose a songspell that is already active. You can continue to use your bonus action on subsequent turns to maintain your songspell and both songspell effects are maintained in this way. If your concentration is broken, you lose both effects immediately.

description.p: At 10th Level, choose two of your skill proficiencies besides Charisma (Performance). Your proficiency bonus is doubled for any ability check you make that uses either of the chosen proficiencies.
Beginning at 11th level, you can expend one use of your songcraft to have your next songspell affect all allies within 30 feet of you as a bonus action.

sheet.description: You can expend one use of your songcraft to have your next songspell affect all allies within 30 feet of you.

description.p: Beginning at 18th level, you can have up to three songspells active simultaneously.

sheet.description: You can have up to three songspells active simultaneously.

description.p: At 20th level, you are a maestro of music. Your Charisma score increases by 4. Your maximum for that score is now 24. Additionally, when you roll for initiative and have no uses of Songcraft remaining, you regain 1 use of it.

sheet.description: When you roll for initiative and have no uses of Songcraft remaining, you regain 1 use of it.

description.p: Many cultures share a need for warriors. And many warriors feed off of the adrenaline that comes from the pounding of drums, the chants of their comrades, and the rhythms of their battle cries. Battle dancers are fighters, lovers, and powerful allies.
At 2nd level, you gain proficiency with martial weapons, chakrams, and war fans.

While you have at least one songspell active, being within 5 feet of a hostile creature doesn’t impose disadvantage on your ranged attack rolls with thrown weapons and attacks made by a thrown weapon ignores half cover and three-quarters cover. Additionally, while you have at least one songspell active, thrown weapons return to you at the end of your turn if you miss an attack with them.
Deflecting
A weapon with this property gains a +1 to AC against ranged weapon attacks. This bonus does not stack if you wield a second deflecting weapon.

sheet.description: While you have at least one songspell active, being within 5 feet of a hostile creature doesn’t impose disadvantage on your ranged attack rolls with thrown weapons and attacks made by a thrown weapon ignores half cover and three-quarters cover. Additionally, while you have at least one songspell active, thrown weapons return to you at the end of your turn if you miss an attack with them.

description.p: At 3rd level, you perform an aggressive and vigorous warcry that makes your foes cower before you. As an action, all creatures you choose within 30 feet of you must make a Charisma saving throw. The DC for this saving throw is equal to 8 + your proficiency bonus + your Charisma modifier. The DC increases by an additional +1 for every songspell you have active when you perform your battle chant.
Creatures who fail this saving throw are shaken and receive a -1 penalty to their AC.

sheet.description: All creatures you choose within 30 feet of you must make a Charisma saving throw (DC {{spellcasting:dc:cha}}) +1 per active songspell. Creatures who fail this saving throw are shaken and receive a -1 penalty to their AC.

description.p: Starting at 6th level, you can attack twice, instead of once, whenever you take the Attack action on your turn.

sheet.description: You can attack twice, instead of once, whenever you take the Attack action on your turn.

description.p: At 14th level, you can cause the magic of your songspells to explode—causing everything within vicinity of them to go up in flames.

As an action, all creatures you choose within 30 feet of you must make a Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, each target takes 4d8 fire damage for each songspell you have active, or half as much damage on a successful one.
The fire spreads around corners. It ignites flammable objects in the area that aren’t being worn or carried.
You can perform this feature a number of times equal to you Charisma modifier, regaining uses on a long rest.

sheet.description: All creatures you choose within 30 feet of you must make a Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, each target takes 4d8 fire damage for each songspell you have active, or half as much damage on a successful one.

description.p: Speakers, motivators—precentors are more than simple wordsmiths. Their voices drip with authority, power, influence, and meaning. Precentors do not waste words: for every breath and tongue holds secret power.
Things you say are more than mere words and phrases. Beginning at 2nd level when you choose this style, you double your proficiency bonus when making Charisma (Persuasion and Intimidation) checks.

sheet.description: You double your proficiency bonus when making Persuasion and Intimidation checks.

description.p: At 3rd level, you can inspire your allies in remarkable ways. As a reaction, whenever a friendly creature within 60 feet of you makes an attack roll, ability check, or saving throw, you may grant them an additional d20 to roll. You can use this feature after the original roll, but before the outcome is revealed.
Once you use this feature, you can’t use it again until you finish a short or long rest.

sheet.description: As a reaction, whenever a friendly creature within 60 feet of you makes an attack roll, ability check, or saving throw, you may grant them an additional d20 to roll.

description.p: Beginning at 6th level, you hear and understand the songs of all tongues and understand all spoken Languages. Moreover, any creature that can understand a language can understand what you say.

sheet.description: You hear and understand the songs of all tongues and understand all spoken Languages. Moreover, any creature that can understand a language can understand what you say.

description.p: Beginning at 14th level, you can perform a musical phrase that negates certain magical effects. You can cast counterspell at will a number of times per day equal to your Charisma modifier. You regain uses of this feature after a long rest.

sheet.description: You can cast counterspell.

description.p: String maestras have mastered the art of instruments such as the lute, vielle, or harp. Like their instruments, string maestras glide around the battlefield—constantly frustrating their opponents in their dance-like combat movements.

Starting at 2nd level, you can use your body to slip and glide like your fingers on strings. You can take a bonus action on each of your turns in combat. This action can be used only to take the Dash, Disengage, or Hide action.

sheet.description: You can Dash, Disengage, or Hide.

description.p: At 3rd level, you can play a haunting sound with your instrument that elicits fear and nervousness in a creature. As an action, choose one target within 60 feet. The target must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or become frightened of you for 1 minute. The frightened target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. A construct or an undead is immune to this effect.
Once you use this feature, you can’t use it again until you finish a short or long rest.

sheet.description: Choose one target within 60 feet. The target must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or become frightened of you for 1 minute. The frightened target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. A construct or an undead is immune to this effect.

description.p: Starting at 6th level, you gain advantage on checks and saving throws to avoid being grappled, paralyzed, or restrained.

sheet.description: You have advantage on checks and saving throws to avoid being grappled, paralyzed, or restrained.

description.p: At 14th level, you can play each of your strings on your instrument and fire a magical ray of power. You can cast prismatic spray at will. Once you use this feature, you can’t use it again until you finish a long rest.

sheet.description: You can cast prismatic spray.

description.p: Wartime drummers have marched their way throughout much of the land’s history. But no simple drummer plays like a rhythm knight—for these warriors bring the thirst for combat and battle with them into the marches of war.
At 2nd level, you gain proficiency in heavy armor. In addition, you gain resistance to thunder and bludgeoning damage.

Starting at 3rd level, you gain tremorsense and can detect and pinpoint the origin of vibrations within 30 feet, provided that you and the source of the vibrations are in contact with the same ground or substance.

sheet.description: You have tremorsense and can detect and pinpoint the origin of vibrations within 30 feet, provided that you and the source of the vibrations are in contact with the same ground or substance.

description.p: Beginning 6th level, you can play a battle march that brings confidence and power to your allies. You can cast crusader’s mantle at will with your instrument.
You can perform this feature a number of times equal to your Charisma modifier and regain uses after a long rest.

sheet.description: You can cast crusader’s mantle at will with your instrument.

description.p: At 14th level, as an action, you can strike your instrument to create a thundering pillar of sound. Each creature in a 10-foot wide and 120-foot long line in a direction you choose must make a Constitution saving throw. On a failed save a creature takes 10d8 thunder damage and is deafened for 10 minutes. On a successful save, it takes half as much damage and is deafened until the end of your next turn.
A creature deafened by this spell makes another Constitution saving throw at the end of each of its turns. On a successful save, it is no longer deafened.

The pillar disperses gas or vapor, and it extinguishes candles, torches, and similar unprotected flames in the area. It causes protected flames, such as those of lanterns, to dance wildly and has a 75 percent chance to extinguish them.
Once you use this feature, you can’t use it again until you finish a long rest.

sheet.description: Each creature in a 10-foot wide and 120-foot long line in a direction you choose must make a Constitution saving throw. On a failed save a creature takes 10d8 thunder damage and is deafened for 10 minutes. On a successful save, it takes half as much damage and is deafened until the end of your next turn.

description.p: You can clear and refocus a creature’s mind. Make a Charisma (Performance) check. One creature of your choice within 30 feet of you gains a bonus to Intelligence, Wisdom, and Charisma based skill checks depending on your Charisma (Performance) result.

tr.td: +2 bonus on Intelligence, Wisdom, and Charisma based skill checks
+3 bonus on Intelligence, Wisdom, and Charisma based skill checks
+4 bonus on Intelligence, Wisdom, and Charisma based skill checks

description.p: You can cause a creature’s body to become more swift and agile. Make a Charisma (Performance) check. One creature of your choice within 30 feet of you gains a bonus to AC when targeted by ranged attacks depending on your Charisma (Performance) result.

You cause bolts and blasts to fly true. Make a Charisma (Performance) check. One creature of your choice within 30 feet of you gains a bonus on ranged attack rolls depending on your Charisma (Performance) result.

You can cause a creature’s skin to harden. Make a Charisma (Performance) check. One creature of your choice within 30 feet of you gains a bonus to AC when targeted by melee attacks depending on your Charisma (Performance) result.

You can allow a creature to traverse vertical surfaces with ease. Make a Charisma (Performance) check. One creature of your choice within 30 feet of you gains a swim speed depending on your Charisma (Performance) result.

You add brevity to a creature’s gait. Make a Charisma (Performance) check. One creature of your choice within 30 feet of you gains a bonus to its speed depending on your Charisma (Performance) result.

You can steel a creature’s mind and soul. Make a Charisma (Performance) check. One creature of your choice within 30 feet of you gains a bonus to Intelligence, Wisdom, and Charisma saving throws depending on your Charisma (Performance) result.

tr.td: +2 bonus on Intelligence, Wisdom, and Charisma saving throws
+3 bonus on Intelligence, Wisdom, and Charisma saving throws
+4 bonus on Intelligence, Wisdom, and Charisma saving throws

description.p: You stir a ferocity inside of your allies. Make a Charisma (Performance) check. One creature of your choice within 30 feet of you gains a bonus die on damage rolls depending on your Charisma (Performance) result.

You can call upon elemental energies to protect your allies. Make a Charisma (Performance) check and choose one type of damage: acid, cold, fire, lightning, necrotic, radiant, or thunder. One creature of your choice within 30 feet of you has the chosen type of damage reduced by a certain amount depending on your Charisma (Performance) result.

You can mend wounds and revitalize your allies. Make a Charisma (Performance) check. One creature of your choice within 30 feet of you regains an amount of hit points depending on your Charisma (Performance) result. Additionally, that creature regains 1 hit point at the beginning of its next turn.

You can allow a creature to glide through water with ease. Make a Charisma (Performance) check. One creature of your choice within 30 feet of you gains a swim speed depending on your Charisma (Performance) result.

You can fill a creature’s body with vigor. Make a Charisma (Performance) check. One creature of your choice within 30 feet of you gains a bonus to Strength, Dexterity, and Constitution saving throws depending on your Charisma (Performance) result.

tr.td: +2 bonus on Strength, Dexterity, and Constitution saving throws
+3 bonus on Strength, Dexterity, and Constitution saving throws
+4 bonus on Strength, Dexterity, and Constitution saving throws

description.p: You can hone a creature’s physical finesse. Make a Charisma (Performance) check. One creature of your choice within 30 feet of you gains a bonus to Strength, Dexterity, and Constitution based skill checks depending on your Charisma (Performance) result.

tr.td: +2 bonus on Strength, Dexterity, and Constitution based skill checks
+3 bonus on Strength, Dexterity, and Constitution based skill checks
+4 bonus on Strength, Dexterity, and Constitution based skill checks

description.p: You can cause the wind beneath a creature to rise. Make a Charisma (Performance) check. One creature of your choice within 30 feet of you gains a flying speed depending on your Charisma (Performance) result.

You spark a rigorous zeal in your allies and encourage them to wade into battle. Make a Charisma (Performance) check. One creature of your choice within 30 feet of you gains a bonus on melee attack rolls depending on your Charisma (Performance) result.
